meanings.definition: The state of having a hood.
meanings.sent1: The hoodedness of the jacket kept her warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: I like the hoodedness of this sweatshirt; it's perfect for rainy days.
meanings.sent3: The hoodedness of the cloak made him look like a mysterious wizard.
meanings.sent4: The hoodedness of the figure in the shadows gave me an eerie feeling.
meanings.sent5: The hoodedness of the costume added an air of secrecy to the character.

meanings.sent1: The hoodedness of the robe made it ideal for a costume party.
meanings.sent2: She admired the hoodedness of the falcon, a symbol of strength and power.
meanings.sent3: The hoodedness of the lampshade created a cozy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent4: The hoodedness of the mountain peak was shrouded in mist at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The hoodedness of the painting added depth and mystery to the artwork.
